snippet: Libyan officials said the strike killed Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a former Al Qaeda leader and the mastermind of a 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead.
abstract: American airstrike in Libya targets, and is said to have killed, Mokhtar Belmokhtar, man accused of being mastermind behind 2013 terrorist seizure of Algerian gas plant; number of other Libyan terrorists are also killed in strike; Belmokthar's death, still not officially confirmed, would amount to significant counterterroism victory for the US.

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from London; Adam Nossiter from Dakar, Senegal; and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.

lead_paragraph: Libyan officials said the strike killed Mokhtar Belmokhtar, a former Al Qaeda leader and the mastermind of a 2013 terrorist seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left 38 foreign hostages dead.

headline.main: U.S. Airstrike in Libya Targets Planner of 2013 Algeria Attack
headline.print_headline: American Strike Targets Planner of Algeria Raid

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
